required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ADME Study of [14C]- Larotinib in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Single Dose Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism, and Excretion Study of [14C] - Larotinib in Healthy Male Participants

brief_summary.textblock: Study to Evaluate the Mass Balance and Biotransformation of Single Dose [14C]-Larotinib（Z650）in healthy male subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative excretion of 14C-labeled drug-related material (radioactivity in plasma, urine and fecal samples)
primary_outcome.description: Percent (%) of each radiolabeled drug-related material (parent and each metabolite) will be determined in plasma, urine and feces.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of the Proportion of different metabolites to determine biotransformation pathway of Larotinib
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of different metabolites(Larotinib and main metabolites） .

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantitive analysis of the concentrations of Larotinib in plasma using the validated LC-MS/MS to obtain pharmacokinetic data
secondary_outcome.description: The concentrations of Larotinib in plasma
Adverse events assessed by CTCAE v5.0.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive single dose of [14C]-Larotinib (Suspension, 350mg/100μCi).

intervention.description: Patients will receive single dose of orally [14C]-Larotinib on Day 1.

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Soochow University
